intro: Piper compactum, commonly known as the dwarf pepper plant, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species such as black pepper. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of tiny, peppery fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of mild spices. Due to its compact growth habit, it is well-suited for container gardening and indoor spaces.
